result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrence Lashawn Crampton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terrence Lashawn Crampton was found guilty of Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds. Balance during term of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
--Restitution set at zero as to Pamela A.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment,  or part time employment and school, or full time school.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with Pamela A., and/or Fairview Tap in City of Milwaukee.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Lashawn Crampton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (19 pages) commencing 02/05/16 received and filed.

Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  7 years  with  325 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  36  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   48 months.  

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero) as to Pamela A.

Court finds defendant   IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Pamela A.    AND/OR   Fairview Tap, City of Milwaukee
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell not in court, but appeared by telephone conference.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Mitchell unable to appear in court on 01-05-2016.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Defense counsel telephoned the court to inform he was unable to appear in court today; case adjourned to 01-06-2016 for rescheduling.
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING IN BRANCH 28.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Sanders presiding in Branch 28 in room 629 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY on COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.   Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell called in sick.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter rescheduled for projected plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request a new projected guilty plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell via telephone in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mitchell ill.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 

Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in custody.  Ron Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pamela A. or Fairview Tap, 6712 W. Fairview Avenue, Milwaukee.

The court advised this is a praxis bail recommendation.   Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or no dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Terrence Lashawn Crampton in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
